description.narrative: 1. GHG emission profiles for power and energy-intensive industries 2. Design of MRV framework for power and energy-intensive industries 3. Piloting the MRV systems 4. Development of a MBI framework 5. Increased public awareness and knowledge about MBI

participating-org.narrative: WORLD BANK (INT'L. BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION & DEVELOPMENT)

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Output 1. 1.1. Reports on GHG Abatement cost curve analysis of power generation and energy intensive industries. Output 2. 2.1. Rules, regulations, and procedures on MRV 2. 2. Institutional set up for MRV 2.3. Capacity building and awareness raising activities for sectoral MRV system in power and energyintensive industries Output 3. 3.1. Map of MRV activities at the installation level in Indonesia. 3.2. Monitoring protocols. 3.3. Data management system at the installation level. 3.4. GHG emission data and review on the MRV system at the installation level and at an aggregated data management level. 4.1. Comprehensive assessment report on MBI options for Indonesia 4.2. Design of selected market-based instruments for the selected sector. 4.3. Draft policy(ies) required for establishment and implementation of MBI. 4.4. Piloting the market-based instrument in the selected sector. 5.1. Market readiness communication and information tool. 5.2. Stakeholders awareness and capacity of MBI options for climate change mitigation. 5.3. Stakeholders involvement in MBI discussion.

comment.narrative:
Output 1. 1.1 The National Council on Climate Change developed a national GHG abatement cost curve covering, inter alia, power and cement sectors (2014).
Output 2. 2.1 Presidential Decree No. 71/2011 obliged sectoral MRV (2011). 2.1 Draft Ministry of Industry regulation on GHG Emissions Reporting (2015). 2.2 Unclear structure on MRV Institution at central/national level 2.3 No known capacity building activities in sectoral MRV area (2016). Output 3. 3.1 No known mapping of MRV activities at the installation level in Indonesia (2016). 3.2 No assessment on existing protocols and its suitability for Indonesian context in power and energyintensive industry sectors (2016). 3.3 No standardized data management systems at the installation level issued by the Government (2016). 3.4 No sectoral GHG emissions data are available for public; No review on MRV system at the installation level as it’s not yet established (2016). 4.1 Ministry of Finance released an Australia-supported Green Paper which recommends economic and fiscal policy strategies for climate change mitigation in Indonesia. Carbon pricing in form of carbon tax/levy is the recommended MBI for energy sector in that Green Paper (2009). 4.2 There was a comprehensive design of a domestic crediting mechanism developed by the late National Council on Climate Change (DNPI). The crediting mechanism was called Nusantara Carbon Scheme and was in preparation to do piloting when DNPI is disbanded. The NCS is not pursued anymore by the GoI and currently there is no other MBI design existed in Indonesia (2015). 4.3 Currently there is no policy that establish an MBI in Indonesia (2016). 4.4 Currently there is no MBI in piloting stage in Indonesia (2016). 5.1 One publication in carbon trading basics were issued by DNPI in 2013 and currently there is no other local reference for carbon market and MBI. 5.2 Awareness and capacity of MBI options are generally low (2016). 5.3 Stakeholders constructive and active participat

Output 1. 1.1 No target for 2021.
Output 2. 2.1 No target for 2021. 2.2 No target for 2021. 2.3 No target for 2021.
Output 3. 3.1 No target for 2021. 3.2 No target for 2021. 3.3 No target for 2021. 3.4 No target for 2021.
Output 4. 4.1 No target for 2021. 4.2 No target for 2021. 4.3 General Framework for Carbon Pricing Instruments in Indonesia. 4.4 No target for 2021
Output 5. 5.1 No target for 2021. 5.2 A series of consultation meetings and disseminations implemented in 2021. 5.3 No target for 2021.

Output 1. 1.1 N/A.
Output 2. 2.1 N/A. 2.2 N/A. 2.3 N/A.
Output 3. 3.1 N/A. 3.2 N/A. 3.3 N/A. 3.4 N/A.
Output 4. 4.1 N/A. 4.2 N/A. 4.3 General framework for carbon pricing instruments in Indonesia is developed, covering forestry sector. Background study for Indonesia carbon pricing policy is completed. 4.4 N/A
Output 5. 5.1 N/A. 5.2 Consultation with stakeholders conducted to gather inputs and disseminate information on carbon pricing instruments in Indonesia 5.3 N/A.

Output 1. 1.1 No target for 2019
Output 2. 2.1 Guidelines and standard procedures for implementing the MRV systems for power and energy-intensive industries. (2018 target). 2.2 Institutional guidelines and standard procedures for implementing the MRV systems for power and energy-intensive industries (2018 target). 2.3 2 (two) capacity building events in implementing the MRV system as a whole
Output 3. 3.1 No target for 2019 3.2 1 (one) comprehensive assessment of monitoring protocols that include comparing and assessing existing protocols, making them applicable to Indonesian conditions where necessary and by developing monitoring rules and templates 3.3 Formulated data management system that measures system’s integrity along with the necessary internal and external procedures for power and energy intensive industry sectors. 3.4 2 (two) MRV system pilots in Jamali power plants and pulp & paper industry is started.
Output 4. 4.1 A comprehensive report on MBI options for Indonesia, including identified MBI options, the expected effects and its feasibility to implement in Indonesia (target for 2018) 4.2 A comprehensive design for an MBI with its definition, scope and coverage agreed by the stakeholders, including necessary procedures and guidelines enabling the MBI to be immediately operational 4.3 Drafts of required policies to establish the designed MBI. 4.4 Piloting of the selected MBI is started. The pilot MBI should be implemented in an area with sound readiness, e.g. in the MRV-ed pilot areas.
Output 5. 5.1 1 (one) briefing paper on MBI principles; 4 (four) quarterly newsletters on MBI and PMR activities; 1 (one) booklet on MBI principles; Other PMR activities’ information materials. 5.2 1 (one) training workshop that include south-to south cooperation and facilitate information exchange from fellow PMR implementing countries. 5.3 1 (one) questionnaire to stakeholders in MBI related issues

Output 1. 1.1. N/A
Output 2. 2.1 & 2.2 Draft guideline for implementing the MRV systems for power has been finalized. The draft has been submitted to DG Electricity (MEMR) for review and approval. Draft of MoI Minister Regulation on Cement CO2 emission MRV System is finalized; Guidelines GHG Inventory for Power Sector is finalized; Draft of MoI Minister regulation on GHG emission reporting is finalized; Guideline for cement has been finalized; Guideline for fertilizer has been finalized. 2.3 4 (four) activities on awareness-raising and capacity-building events were conducted with more than 1,000 professional (from private sectors)and government representatives attended.
Output 3 3.1 N/A 3.2 For power: Monitoring Protocol aspects has been completed and included in the draft regulations on sectoral MRV. No company or experts were hired for this activity. The MRV system completed and launched on August 2018. For Industry: Improvements on MRV Guideline for cement and fertilizer have been completed. MRV Guideline for pulp and paper was finalized in Q1 2019. 3.3 For Power, an online GHG data management system in the power sector, named APPLE-Gatrik, is established. For industry, the data management system is incorporated in the SIINAS database. 3.4 MRV pilots for power sector has launched since August 2018 and are ongoing. MRV pilot verification for GHG emission data, for power, cement and fertilizer industries are completed.
Output 4. 4.1 A Final Report of MBI Options for Indonesia was published in April 2019 4.2 The results of this output are already covered in the study on MBI options in Indonesia (4.1) 4.3 The ETS pilot discussions on Power and Cement Sector is being negotiated. A voluntary pilot is agreed. 4.4 Implementation of ICER as a carbon offset mechanism for Indonesia is ongoing.
Output 5. 5.1 1 (one) briefing paper on MBI principles completed; 2 newsletters have been published; 1 (one) booklet on MBI principles is completed; update on PMR website and other PMR social media is ongoing. 5.2 1 (one) training workshop that include south-to-south cooperation has been conducted on March 2019 5.3 1 final Questionnaire has been distributed/disseminated in July 2019

Output 1. 1.1 No target for 2020.
Output 2. 2.1 No target for 2020. 2.2 No target for 2020. 2.3 No target for 2020.
Output 3. 3.1 No target for 2020. 3.2 No target for 2020. 3.3 No target for 2020. 3.4 No target for 2020.
Output 4. 4.1 No target for 2020. 4.2 No target for 2020. 4.3 A white paper for general framework of carbon pricing implementation in Indonesia (PMR additional funding). 4.4 Piloting of the selected MBI is started. The pilot MBI should be implemented in an area with sound readiness, e.g. in the MRV-ed pilot areas.
Output 5. 5.1 No target for 2020. 5.2 No target for 2020. 5.3 No target for 2020.

White paper development and carbon pricing policy legal drafts being drafted in-house by UNDP expert/consultant team. Moreover, by end of 2020, the sectors piloting has been discussed and would be implemented by UNDP PMR team jointly with the working groups together with the relevant government counterparts.
Not applicable. Project ends in Feb 2021
